keyword: calories in 4 cups of chinese seafood soup
title: Calories in 4 Cups of Chinese Seafood Soup
meta_description: Discover calories in 4 cups of Chinese seafood soup, including protein, carbs, fat, sodium details, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in 4 Cups of Chinese Seafood Soup
assumptions: Typical clear broth with shrimp, scallops, fish, mixed vegetables (bok choy, mushrooms); no noodles, oil, or thickeners; ~240 ml per cup.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredients, portion size, and preparation; restaurant versions may be saltier or oilier. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 4 cups of Chinese seafood soup provide ~480 kcal and ~48 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add rice noodles (1/4 cup per serving)
Include tofu instead of half the seafood

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 cup of Chinese seafood soup?
faqs.a: About 120 kcal per cup under standard assumptions.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in 4 cups of Chinese seafood soup?
faqs.a: Approximately 48 g of protein from the seafood.
Yes, ~8 g carbs per cup, mostly from vegetables.

faqs.q: Why is sodium high in seafood soup?
faqs.a: Broth and seasonings contribute; ~750 mg per cup, so watch intake.

faqs.q: How does preparation affect calories in Chinese seafood soup?
faqs.a: Clear broth is lower; added oil, noodles, or creamy bases increase calories significantly.
